required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Cola on Urinary Stone Risk Factors
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Cola on Urinary Stone Risk Factors

brief_summary.textblock: Examine the effects of cola on risks of kidney stones

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective crossover study examining the risks of cola on stone risk factors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of each 6-day intervention in Cola and Water Phase
primary_outcome.description: The Plasma and Urine Parameters that were assessed at the end of cola and water (arms) phase: Plasma Parameters: CA (mg per dL) GLU (mg per dL) BUN (mg per dL) Cr (mg per dL) Prot (mg per dL) ALB (mg per dL) Urine Parameters: uCa (mg per dL) uMg (mg per dL) uP (mg per dL) uCr (mg per dL) uCit (mg per dL) uOx (mg per dL) uUA (mg per dL) The parameters were consolidated into the one value as a mean of all the values in the phase or group (Table 3) and later for longitudinal analysis as a mean of all the values in the phase for each participant (Table 4). measure of dispersion was standard deviation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of 6-day intervention of Cola and water phase
primary_outcome.description: The Plasma and Urine Parameters that were assessed at the end of cola and water (arms) phase: Plasma Parameters: Na (mEq per L) K (mEq per L) CL (mEq per L) CO2(mEq per L) AG (mEq per L) The parameters were consolidated into the one value as a mean of all the values in the phase or group (Table 3) and later for longitudinal analysis as a mean of all the values in the phase for each participant (Table 4). measure of dispersion was standard deviation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of 6-day intervention of cola and water phase
primary_outcome.description: The Plasma osmolarity that were assessed at the end of cola and water (arms) phase: Plasma Parameters: OSM (mOsm/L) The parameters were consolidated into the one value as a mean of all the values in the phase or group (Table 3) and later for longitudinal analysis as a mean of all the values in the phase for each participant (Table 4). measure of dispersion was standard deviation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of 6-day intervention of Cola and water phase
primary_outcome.description: The Urine Parameters that were assessed at the end of cola and water (arms) phase: Urine Parameters: uNa (mEq per d) uK (mEq per d) The parameters were consolidated into the one value as a mean of all the values in the phase or group (Table 3) and later for longitudinal analysis as a mean of all the values in the phase for each participant (Table 4). measure of dispersion was standard deviation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of each 6-day intervention in Cola and Water Phase
secondary_outcome.description: The Plasma and Urine Parameters that were assessed at the end of cola and water (arms) phase: Urine Parameters: Total Urine Volume (mL/day) The parameters were consolidated into the one value as a mean of all the values in the phase or group (Table 3) and later for longitudinal analysis as a mean of all the values in the phase for each participant (Table 4). measure of dispersion was standard deviation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of each 6-day intervention in Cola and Water Phase
secondary_outcome.description: The Urine pH that were assessed at the end of cola and water (arms) phase The parameters were consolidated into the one value as a mean of all the values in the phase or group (Table 3) and later for longitudinal analysis as a mean of all the values in the phase for each participant (Table 4). measure of dispersion was standard deviation.

arm_group.description: Subjects will be given 500cc of Cola twice daily.
Subjects will be given 500cc of deionized water.

intervention.description: Subjects will be given 500cc of Cola beverage twice daily to be ingested with breakfast and dinner for six days while on a metabolic diet.There will be a three weeks interval before crossover to the other treatment arm.

Subjects will be given 500cc of deionized water to be ingested twice daily with breakfast and dinner for three weeks while on a metabolic diet. There will be a three weeks interval before crossover to the other treatment arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- urolithiasis, healthy volunteer
Exclusion Criteria:

results_reference.citation: Herrel L, Pattaras J, Solomon T, Ogan K. Urinary stone risk and cola consumption. Urology. 2012 Nov;80(5):990-4. doi: 10.1016/j.urology.2012.07.003. Epub 2012 Sep 25.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruited patients of Emory University Department of Urology
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Normal subjects and calcium oxalate stone-formers were included.

group.title: Cola First, Then Water
group.description: Phase 1: Subjects will be given 500cc of Cola beverage twice daily to be ingested with breakfast and dinner for six days while on a metabolic diet. There will be a three weeks wash-out period before patients entere phase 2 of thre study. Phase 2: Subjects will be given 500cc of deionized water twice daily to be ingested with breakfast and dinner for six days while on a metabolic diet.

baseline.population: Thirteen subjects, including 10 normal subjects and 3 calcium oxalate stone-formers were enrolled in this prospective cross-over study.

group.title: Cola First, Then Water
group.description: Phase 1: Subjects will be given 500cc of Cola beverage twice daily to be ingested with breakfast and dinner for six days while on a metabolic diet. There will be a 3-week wash out period before subjects enter phase 2 of the study. Phase 2: Subjects will be given 500 cc of deionized water beverage twice daily to be ingested with breakfast and dinner for six days while on a metabolic diet.

outcome.title: The Plasma and Urine Parameters
outcome.description: The Plasma and Urine Parameters that were assessed at the end of cola and water (arms) phase: Plasma Parameters: CA (mg per dL) GLU (mg per dL) BUN (mg per dL) Cr (mg per dL) Prot (mg per dL) ALB (mg per dL) Urine Parameters: uCa (mg per dL) uMg (mg per dL) uP (mg per dL) uCr (mg per dL) uCit (mg per dL) uOx (mg per dL) uUA (mg per dL) The parameters were consolidated into the one value as a mean of all the values in the phase or group (Table 3) and later for longitudinal analysis as a mean of all the values in the phase for each participant (Table 4). measure of dispersion was standard deviation.
outcome.time_frame: at the end of each 6-day intervention in Cola and Water Phase

group.title: Cola
group.description: they ingested 500 mL of cola (regular Publix brand©) twice daily, with breakfast and dinner.

group.title: Water
group.description: participants ingested 500 mL of deionized water twice daily, with breakfast and dinner.

group.title: Cola Beverage Phase
group.description: Subjects were given 500cc of Cola twice daily to be ingested with breakfast and dinner for six days while on a metabolic diet. There will be a three weeks interval (wash out period) before crossover to the other treatment arm. No adverse event reported.

group.title: Deionized Water Drinking Phase
group.description: Subjects were given 500cc of regular deionized water twice daily to be ingested with breakfast and dinner for six days while on a metabolic diet. No adverse event reported.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
